parents.mother: Marguitte fille Pierrat Colas Schenal of Saulcy

confession.devil_appearance: appeared as a black and white dog (when punishing her for not attending sabbat)
confession.seduction_context: At la Gotte Morel, Persin promised to make her rich, and as there was great dearth at time she consented
sabbat_activities: she wore mask of black paper

testimony.quarrel_subject: His sow got into her garden; she chased it out striking it with broom. Also quarrel about his bull stuck in rocks. Also about his lamb killed by horses.
heard previous witness quarrelling with her
He broke the leg of her goat which continually damaged his garden despite repeated warnings
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il ne seroit tousjours sy gros, et viendroit quelque fois avec eulx, voulant dire qu'il deviendroit pauvre (that he would not always be so fat, and would come to be with them, meaning he would become poor)

witnesses.name: Jean Jeandel
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, son-in-law of Jean Colin le vieux

testimony.quarrel_subject: His wife was angry when accused chased pigs out of her garden; wife later told accused she was the devil

Leased moictresse from Nicolas Miette which included garden where she had been servant and put geese to graze. Despite warnings she let geese get in garden; he killed several and when she called him 'meschant homme' he called her witch. She complained to Bastien la Hiere but got no redress.
testimony.threat_quote: She told him she had been at moictresse before him, and would be again after him

witnesses.name: Claudatte femme Jean Jeandel
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, daughter-in-law of Jean Colin le vieux

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused chased pigs out of her garden; she told accused she was the devil

Called accused to childbed of first child (accused was helping to feed their animals), suggested she be godmother but had to withdraw this because already promised to another. For second child, tried to make amends by asking her husband to be godfather, but accused wanted her son to act, and was angry when told he was too young. Also quarrel about damage to field of wheat. Also land rental dispute.

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: immediately after godfather dispute, died after 19 weeks
after husbands quarrelled about wheat field damage
next day after land rental dispute

testimony.quarrel_subject: Claudette's son Mengin complained that her goats were eating their hedges; her husband retorted they were doing little damage and it was better to have goats than to lease cows and large moictresse
Her son Mengin struck one of his cows across the back with stick, making it fall; his wife struck Mengin; Claudette was angry and threatened her

witnesses.name: Demenge Foelix
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, husband of Jehennon femme Demenge Foelix

testimony.quarrel_subject: Same as wife - godparenting disputes and land rental

harms_alleged.target: cow (with abscess on neck containing red hair and powder that vanished)
cow (struck with stick, could not walk properly; recovered after eating herbs from accused's garden)

witnesses.name: Urbain Sagaire
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, husband of Mengeatte femme Urbain Sagaire

testimony.quarrel_subject: Same as wife about goats; also he was cursing witches and wishing they were burned; she overheard and asked if he was charging her

harms_alleged.target: goat (good milker, lost milk then died 2 weeks later as if rabid)
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: immediately after she remarked what a good milker it was

timeline.subject: Claudette Guillematte
timeline.details: Confrontation with Laurence femme Mengeon Demenge Benay of la Fosse (held at château of Taintrux), who identified her as tall woman seen at sabbat

timeline.subject: Claudette Guillematte
timeline.details: Procureur for canons asks court at St Dié to investigate, arrest and interrogate if evidence sufficient

timeline.subject: Claudette Guillematte
timeline.details: First interrogation; denied everything; refused to renounce Napnel

timeline.subject: Claudette Guillematte
timeline.details: Procureur for canons asks for question ordinaire

timeline.subject: Claudette Guillematte
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; given thumbscrews then racked; confessed; brought back same afternoon and confirmed confessions

timeline.subject: Claudette Guillematte
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

prior_accusations.context: Named Claudette as tall woman of la Bolle seen at sabbat; initially thought her name was Catherine

notable_quotes.speaker: Mengeon Demenge de Mortaigne
notable_quotes.french: qu'il luy feroit razer le poil du cul
notable_quotes.english: that he would have her arrested (literally: that he would have the hair of her ass shaved)
notable_quotes.context: Threat he made to accused during quarrel, overheard by witness Anthoine Bergier

notable_quotes.speaker: Pierron Anthoine, reporting Claudette's words
notable_quotes.french: qu'il ne seroit tousjours sy gros, et viendroit quelque fois avec eulx, voulant dire qu'il deviendroit pauvre
notable_quotes.english: that he would not always be so fat, and would come to be with them, meaning he would become poor
notable_quotes.context: Tacit threat after he broke leg of her goat

relationships.evidence_text: wife of George Mengin, laboureur and manouvrier
Daughter of Colas Guillematte of ban de Taintrux
mother Marguitte fille Pierrat Colas Schenal of Saulcy
When living previously with father-in-law Jean Colin le vieux
also some of accusations by father (previous witness)
killing her brother-in-law Jean Mengin, with whom she was in dispute over property
servant of late maire Gregoire Miette at his moictresse
quarrel about goat damaging his garden

economic_context.details: Was in property dispute with brother-in-law Jean Mengin (whom she confessed to killing). Previously servant at moictresse, later leased from Nicolas Miette. Jean Colin le vieux testified she told him 'she had been at moictresse before him, and would be again after him' - suggesting ongoing tension over property/land access. Evidence of great dearth at time of seduction (20 years before trial). Multiple witnesses mention land/garden disputes and moictresse (farm) leasing arrangements.

material_culture.context: Claudette chased sow out of garden striking it with broom
Claudette put geese to graze in garden; Jean Colin le vieux killed several
Claudette's son struck cow with stick; Claudette struck cow with stick
Mengeon Demenge paid her a franc after lamb killed by horses
Economic value of cows (9 écus, 7 écus)
Total value of animals lost (more than 1000 francs, 22 francs for goats)
Confessed to using powders: black to kill, red to cause languishing, white to cure
Executioner found in abscess on cow's neck (but vanished)
Used to cure animals afflicted by accused
Confessed to wearing mask of black paper at sabbat
Given to accused during torture when thought to have devil in throat
Confessed to putting powder in Jean Mengin's soup to kill him

animal_predation: black and white dog (identified as Persin in form of dog) that bit Urbain Sagaire as child

Claudette consented to devil's seduction because he promised to make her rich and there was great dearth
Multiple property/land disputes suggesting economic pressure
Disputes over grazing rights, garden access, moictresse leasing

prior_legal_disputes.description: Jean Colin le vieux called her 'meschant homme'; she complained to Bastien la Hiere but obtained no redress since it had been her fault for letting birds stray

legal_context.redress_outcome: obtained no redress; fault was hers for letting geese stray into garden

emotional_state_notes: difficulty breathing during torture (thought to have devil in throat)

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: No specific reproaches to witnesses; simply maintained denials and said that they lied in some cases

third_parties.context: Late maire; Claudette came to la Bolle as his servant at his moictresse

third_parties.name: Demenge Foelix's brother

third_parties.name: Bastien Stablo
third_parties.context: From la Bolle; seen at sabbat

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with 13 witnesses, detailed harms catalog, confession under torture, execution. Notable features: extensive property/land disputes, economic hardship context (great dearth mentioned), multiple witnesses from same family (Jean Colin le vieux, his daughter-in-law, son-in-law), physical evidence of powder in cow's abscess, unusual detail about refusing to renounce Napnel specifically.
